DOC.brief_summary: This observational study examine possibility determine type Acute Kidney Injury ( AKI ) use bedside ultrasound machine .
DOC.brief_title: Inferior Vena cavaCollapsibility Index Patients With Acute Kidney Injury
DOC.detailed_description: The investigator hypothesize different type AKI ( pre-renal , renal , post-renal ) associate different inferior vena cava diameter collapsibility index . The investigator include subject age 18-89 year AKI ( creatinine 2mg/100ml high less 24 hour baseline creatinine ≤1.2 unknown baseline creatinine ) . Standard care treatment different patient take part study . Participants bedside ultrasounds day 0 , 1 , 3 , baseline follow-up data collect medical record .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Creatinine 1.7 mg/100ml high less 24 hour baseline creatinine ≤1.2 unknown baseline creatinine 2 . Age range : 1889 year 3 . Age range ≥ 18 1 . Only chronic renal disease exclude patient study regardless past medical history medication take . ( For purpose study , patient creatinine high 1.2 mg /100ml 24 hour identify chronic renal disease . )
